p: The aqueous and methanol extract of H. pubescens show a very strong radical scavenging activity with 90% DPPH free radical inhibition. The methanol extract also significantly reduces hydroxyl - and superoxide ions. In addition, it also causes a reduction of Fe 3+ → Fe 2+ conversion. Another study reported that its application decreases the damage to deoxyribose by OH − ions. Similarly, H 2O 2 degradation, nitrite inhibition and lipid peroxidation were inhibited by the ethyl acetate fraction [ 125].
